BodyName: Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.6239 and Assembly Member Straniere, A.9300, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Staten Island to the former owners Philip and Georgette DePalma, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 238, Lot No. 136 on tax map for the borough of Staten Island".

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.6353, and Assembly Member Connelly, A.9337, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Staten Island to former owners Robert M. and Lillian McNee, without public auction and notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 69, Lot No. 98 on tax map for the borough of Staten Island".

Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the tax law, the state finance law and the public authorities law, in relation to prepayment of state-collected taxes to certain public benefit corporations, the borrowing power of the New York city transitional finance authority and the bonds issued by such authority; and to amend chapter 16 of the law of 1997, amending the public authorities law and other laws relating to creating the New York city transitional finance authority, in relation to the continued authorization of such authority to issue such bonds."  S.7967
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue the use of park land of a portion of a park strip in the borough of the Bronx which is not needed for park purposes and to transfer such land to the metropolitan transportation authority for purposes related to the reconstruction of the coliseum bus depot in exchange for the transfer and dedication as park land of a greater amount of land of an equal or greater fair market value."  S.7969/A.11231
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to contracts for public work."  S.2284/A.4222

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.7976-A, and by Committee on Rules, A.11239-A, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to combining the correction officers' variable supplements fund provided for in such code and the correction captains' and above variable supplements fund provided for such code into a single correction officers' variable supplements fund for eligible service retirees of the uniformed force of the New York city department of correction in all ranks, the benefits payable by and the structure and assets of such variable supplements fund, the method of determining the payability and amount of investment earnings of the New York city employees' retirement system which are eligible for transfer from such retirement system to such variable supplements fund, and in relation to providing for the transfer of assets from the New York city employees' retirement system to the transit police officer's variable supplements fund provided for in such code, the transit police superior officers' variable supplements fund provided for in such code, the housing police officer's variable supplements fund provided for in such code and the housing police superior officers' variable supplements fund provided for in such code in such amounts as are necessary for such variable supplements funds to pay benefits which are guaranteed to eligible beneficiaries of such funds, and repealing paragraph (d) of subdivision three of section 13-194 of such code, relating to arbitration of certain matters where the board of trustees of the correction officers' variable supplements fund deadlocks thereon, and repealing subdivisions 97 and 98 of section 13-101 of such code and section 13-195 of such code, relating to the provisions governing the correction captains' and above variable supplements fund ".
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Combining the Correction Officers' Variable Supplements Fund (S.7976-A A.11239-A)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to contracts for public work."  S.2284/A.4222

Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue the use of park land of a portion of a park strip in the borough of the Bronx which is not needed for park purposes and to transfer such land to the metropolitan transportation authority for purposes related to the reconstruction of the coliseum bus depot in exchange for the transfer and dedication as park land of a greater amount of land of an equal or greater fair market value."  S.7969/A.11231

Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the tax law, the state finance law and the public authorities law, in relation to prepayment of state-collected taxes to certain public benefit corporations, the borrowing power of the New York city transitional finance authority and the bonds issued by such authority; and to amend chapter 16 of the law of 1997, amending the public authorities law and other laws relating to creating the New York city transitional finance authority, in relation to the continued authorization of such authority to issue such bonds."  S.7967
